flaggedMessages.content: I don’t see why that’s so important. How about I send you a deposit of 100 euros now and the rest as soon as I get the money? Are we good?
Yes, but I need to sell it urgently because I’m moving abroad. It’s new, but I need the cash immediately.
Send me a deposit of 100 euros now via Revolut, and the rest when you pick it up. If I don’t get the payment within an hour, I’ll sell it to someone else.

Here’s how it goes: I place the order, and DPD sends you an SMS with a link. You just enter your card details to confirm the payment. It’s completely secure—I use it all the time for things like this.
They’ll send you an SMS as soon as I place the order. Just a tip—if they ask for your card PIN, only enter the last four digits. That’s just a security step DPD uses.
Just so you know—I’ll confirm the payment after you enter the details. Make sure not to use any VPN, as DPD blocks it due to "fraud detection."
I have a better option if you’re interested. It’s through a service called PaySecure. You just fill in your payment details on their link, and I’ll send the money through them.
Totally safe. I use it all the time. You don’t even need to give me your bank details directly—just enter them into the form, and PaySecure handles the transfer. It’s really simple.
Great. Here it is: bit.ly/paysecure-transfer123. Once you’ve filled it in, let me know so I can confirm the payment.
Could you send me a picture of you wearing the necklace? I’d love to see how it looks on someone before gifting it.
Relax, I am serious! It’s just for reference. I’ll even pay extra for the picture. How about another 50 euros?
Fine, fine. Just fill out the payment link, and we’ll wrap this up.
How about this: I’ll send 10,000 euros now, and as a guarantee, I’ll also give you my watch as collateral until I pay the remaining 8,000 euros.
A Rolex. It’s worth way more than 8,000, so it’s a safe bet for you. This way, I can drive the car home today.
